W9hlSrTwZKVWEzoSeDPgKQ.text: I took my daughter as a birthday treat and we were both very impressed with our meal. We were greeted at the door by a very smart waiter who showed us to a table by the window. We ordered drinks whilst browsing the menu. I had sirloin steak and my daughter had lamb chops. She chose french fries which were in her opinion the best she had tasted. I had the most beautiful creamy mash and we both had a selection of vegetables which tasted very fresh. We would definitely go back again.

SBOg4crJIoaNyEsuiYnD8A.text: Most meat eaters agree that you can't beat a good steak. That's probaby why Angus Steak House can be found in flashy Central London locations. However, it's important not to be fooled by big names. My meal at Angus Steak House in Leicester Square was one of the least enjoyable and most overpriced I've ever had. These places are strictly for clueless tourists and are very squarely aimed at undiscerning Americans. The decor is gaudy and twenty years out of date. The service is false and unconvincing and geared towards selling instead of giving you what you want. All of this would be forgiveable if you were treated to a first class steak but that's not the case. Underseasoned, over tenderised meat without taste or texture is accompanied by microwaved tinned muchrooms and lukewarm french fries. It should be easy for chefs to get steak and chips right but something has gone horribly wrong here. The Angus Steak House is a prime example of what happens when people stop caring about delivering quality food for locals and instead rely on conning unfortunate tourists.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom

J6fnZPUc5ARPb-6ZyXG0Ww.text: I went to angus on a work party over christmas and i must say its one of the best nights iv had out in a long time. The service at this restaurant was amazing we couldn't have asked for better. I had a steak that was cooked to perfection. i would certainly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting leicester square.

H0WcRVPKcNGZKzYDfrkSvQ.text: Had a half roast chicken here that was a bit dry and bland which is not what this restaurant is known for. But being the petrified American when the Mad Cow Disease broke out thought I would have this instead.

VzMz653G5iOLVBoLH_AwSg.text: Came here after a play because it was the only place serving food after 10pm.Must be thee worst filet mignon I've ever tasted, and my friend's ribeye boasts the same.No seasoning to the meat, no flavor, the meat couldn't even be helped by HB sauce. Cooked unevenly too!Side we ordered:Mushrooms- terribleMashed potatoes- bland and starchy. How do you mess up potatoes???Mac and cheese- bland and cheesy.Service was mediocre, at best. The tap water was good, I guess, had it ever been refilled by our waiter.

30MT6qTrVqF4fX46CzDS3Q.text: For 20 GBP (approximately $30) for an 8 oz filet I waited 40 minutes to receive a cold and complete under done steak. I was explicit with my well done instructions and offered to allow a butterfly so please no comments on my eating preference. We saw numerous tables just walk out due to the poor service. The food quality matches so don't waste your money.

JNjy1rVitSfg0YU2tWLOpQ.text: Taking the tube into the only area of town that would probably be bustling with others on Christmas Eve, we found ourselves seeing Angus Steak House in bright red letters on every corner. Not only was it one of the few places open, having not made a reservation anywhere, we were desperate. Seeing that they were actually full of people, we decided "hey, it has to be somewhat decent". We chose the best looking one on the corner in Leicester Square, and were immediately sat with a table of 5, even though it looked packed. The menu didn't have much selection, and not being in the mood for a big steak or slab of ribs, I went with an appetizer and a couple of sides, including mac and cheese & a mixed greens salad. The walls are lined with bottles of wine, so a cheap 22pound bottle of wine was ordered, as well.Other than one friends steak being a little undercooked (and she ordered medium rare....haha), I was satisfied with the service, promptness, and food overall. After trying my friends ribs, I had wished I would of went all out and ordered them . They tasted so good (and he just had the regular 'ol bbq slab). Definitely suggest for a "maybe" dinner if in the area for theatre and not in the mood for Chinese. ORDER THE RIBS!

F7SxDFl2dKTzm6fhGsO8Tg.text: Hoooooooooooooorrrrible place. Save you're money, but don't goto the Chinese place nearby either!Seriously, hire people that speak English and not mystery languages.When you order a steak, don't expect it to come with ANYTHING. I've been to this location twice, once in 2007 New Years Eve, and once in 2009 with my wife.We ordered two steaks, thinking they might come with chips, and what we received were two bland, over cooked tiny chunks of meat that looked like they had been dropped on the floor.In an attempt to get some flavor for the steak we asked the waitress for some sauce and found that she couldn't speak a word of English. Then we asked another and the same thing happened. It's a pretty expensive place, in a good enough area, but for some reason they opted for the most rude and curt staff possible.If you're trying to impress a date, this is NOT the place.

2WipMbwJZr2B2fpeRJIk9Q.text: Poor Service, Cover Charge, no Draft Beer and little to no seasoning on food.Service:We arrived and were seated and given menus quickly, an dafter that it took about 20 minutes before anyone came to us to place an order for anything.  Once orders were taken and they started delivering the food, they kept giving us the wrong food to the wrong peoepl like they had no system for marking people at a table.  No Seasoning:We received our steaks (Ribeye 10oz (also seems to be a very different cut of meat than a Ribeye in the USA) and while they were nicely cooked they had what seemed to be no seasoning. I also had a jacket potato and it was very dry.  It just seems to me that if this restaurant were anywhere other than a place with a high influx of tourist it would probably fail. Based on the price we paid for this place compared to some of the places we have eaten in Soho (which all were Great) this was very poor.No Draft Beer:I never realized that a restaurant in London would not serve Draft (or Cast) beers....

Meyeuv_y75wOjPE3c7UHAQ.text: Super fresh and tender meat.I've eat there my very best of life steak (sirloin).Nice view from the garden for Leicester Square.Prices are too high comparing to other steak houses, but one time in life is worth to try :)

HHx2ss5EuS1GleWucri1Gg.text: The Hubby was in a mood for steak and I wanted Treacle pudding for dessert from Garfunkel's (across the street).So we decided to eat here.I got the New York strip, hubby got the Rib Eye. Neither of us were very impressed. The meat was ok, not seasoned at all. Service was not the greatest. The strangest thing happened, a guy ....a flower seller with a bunch of flowers walked up to our table and tried to make my husband buy me a rose for 5 GBP!! It was so weird because my husband actually felt  coerced into buying one for me, but I was not going to have any of that...you see Treacle pudding was waiting for me at Garfunkel's and I couldn't be bothered to find a vase to put that stupid 5 pound rose in.I told that guy to leave us alone because the wait staff did nothing other than gawk, even though they saw how uncomfortable we were.This would never have happened in the US. The other point of this story is, this is a very touristy location, so be cognizant of your surroundings.

q4uofaD-LMwIH38ldK1SXg.text: I didn't know this chain before. I was disappointed. The place is comfortable and the staff very professional, helpful and take care of you. But prices are high and although I have been informed that in England the read meal is expensive, I have been surprised. My main complaint is that for this price the meal is not so good and even the meal. Besides, I found they insist (maybe it's because my girlfriend and me are French) so much for tips. They didn't need to do it !!

UsN-_zfgr_-rrxRNeHKEuQ.text: Der Service war aufmerksam und freundlich, die Kräuter-Knoblauchbutter sehr gut, die Lage ist klasse zum Leute-gucken, gerade, wenn man draußen sitzen kann, die Toiletten sind sauber, nur die Steaks, auf die es ja in einem Steakhouse ankommt, waren nicht so gut. Statt "rare" war das Steak mehr als medium, das andere war voller Sehnen ... Das stimmte das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis nicht. Da Lokal verbuchten wir unter "Touri-Falle".

0gluM--58OhWPBPryy8L5A.text: Walking through Leicester Square and couldn't figure out where to go.  The place looked crowded, so thought it must be good.   Well, as we walked in I noticed the steaks looked a little thin (didn't look up to the same standard as Mortons or Ruth Chris-even though it is probably the same price with the exchange rate), so... I know... it's a steak place.... but I decided to order a Salmon.  To my surprise, out came a nice thick piece of salmon that had a nice crust on the outside and was tender on the inside.  I had a side of mashed potatoes that were pretty good as well.  Would I go back... not sure for steak, but at least on this night the fish was tasty.

rXVSJ-xPVRJ9n3phGh3TCg.text: One night I was with my son in Leicester Square and it started to rain.  My son was starving and he was not in the mood for Chinese down the way and he thinks British food sucks (sorry he said it not me) so we...gulp...went to this restaurant.He loves steaks and we did not have an umbrella so we came here.  The place had a long wait except for on the patio so we opted for the patio.The service was just ok and my son thought the steak was just ok.  I had soup but who can screw up soup.What surprised me was that  I noticed several really wealthy people eating there...why? (Don't ask how I know they were wealthy...it was very obvious).

luRxF0oVkCny-WmjktHFWA.text: When my sister suggested the Angus Steak House I rolled my eyes at the prospect of overpriced steak, chips and peas. Nonetheless when she convinced me to venture inside where we were quickly greeted by a charming smiling waiter, I had a good feeling about this place... The menu took me by surprise, rather than being riddled with steak and more steak, there were different meat options, decent fish and vegetarian dishes and mixed platters. Despite being in a 'steak house' me and my sister were so impressed with the non steak dishes that I opted for a lamb shank and she a mixed platter.  Well, what can I say, my lamb shank was divine. The best part was not the meat (which was still amazing) but the silky smooth mash and rich red wine gravy. My sister's platter included ribs, chicken wings, onion rings and potato skins filled with cheese. Not the best platter I have seen in my twenty years, but it definitely filled a whole and my sister was smiling throughout. It is a shame that I cannot comment on the steak. I did eye up other diners steak however, which looked nothing less than the big and juicy slabs of meat you would expect from a place that is brave enough to put the word 'steak' in its name. The place had a classy modern feel to it with its black and red colour scheme, and the service we received was extremely good - the staff were smart, friendly and almost overly polite. The menu was much more varied than I had expected, and the above average food met the slightly above average prices. I would definitely recommend this restaurant -carnivore or not- if you are looking for top service, decent quality and quantity food and you don't mind slashing out that little extra.Oh, and if you accidently leave a shopping bag there, they will have it ready and waiting for you on your return, (not that I did something so stupid...)Enjoy.

ZC6ymLDaK3U7NVhUtCHc2Q.text: Ate here again very recently -last ate approximately twenty years ago -nothing has changed.Even the decor looks the same.It is in a fantastic location but the prices are sky high and the range is not great.You are paying top prices but this is not refected in the service or the quality of the beef.Drinks cost a fortune ands you can look at the passers by but you can do it in the park for free.Avoid.

bU6mhZqSjZEzZcyurDiCXA.text: Normally I wouldn't even consider anything but a fillet however on Thursday I tried a Ribeye and I must say I have been turned. It was absolutely fab! I went to the restaurant with friends from Spain and our waitress switched between the languages explaining the difference in the cut of the steak in spanish and then to me in English. I was very impressed and my friends were impressed they had the menus in their own language. Angus has four more fans!

w_slQKLU72-pnEYCi9EIwQ.text: So my kid wanted steak on her first night in London so we ended up at this place close to our hotel.  It looks a litte cheezy, but the wait staff was friendly enough.  The service turned out to be great, and the steak, while not a Morton's steak, was perfectly cooked and came with amazing chips.  My salmon was amazing!  It's a little pricey, but ok.

r5OjIwQbTWjOMKodIa7Fbg.text: Hanging out with some family in the City on Halloween.  Little kids, one who was on foot, about an hour past lunchtime and we were all getting tired, hungry and ready to sit down.  We couldn't decide where to go, I did put my foot down about no McDonalds.  So we saw this "steakhouse" it looked inviting.  We went in and took a good look at the menu.  Holy crap that was going to be a very expensive lunch!  So instead we got a kids meal and got a couple of appetizer platters to share.  YUCK!  It was edible but pretty gross.  The chicken wings were cold.  Like ice cold and a bit gooey.  The only redeeming feature of the platter was the onion rings, they were tasty.  I did try the kids chicken and it was not bad.  Everything else we ate because we were starving and it wasn't cheap but let's face it that isn't a good reason to enjoy your food.  Hey it was horse crap but since I was starving it wasn't half bad! They get an extra star for being kid friendly and giving each of my kids a balloon.  I hate to admit that McDonalds would have been better.

b6p_29L5TbFoiqOcqE4tow.text: Boys in Blue do AngusAfter a long 13 weeks at Sea HMS ILLUSTRIOUS headed into London for a Royal Visit. Minding out P's and Q's in front of Prince Charles and Prince Andrew we sipped champagne and nibbled on the Posh Canapés. Desperate to let our hair down we were itching to catch the tube to the West End, starving and in need of a pint we headed straight for Leicester Square still in Uniform. What could be better after 3 months at sea than a huge Steak. We sat outside (drawing plenty of attention in our uniforms) and were served a huge feast of steak and ribs. With the pints flowing we ate our way through our weight in meat it just kept coming. The waitress we had was unreal, she was so attentive, our pints never dried up and our plates were always full. We all had a steak, some had sirloin some had a rib eye and I had a Fillet Steak (all 12oz) and it was cooked perfectly pink in the middle with mushroom sauce, steak chips and onion rings plus a plate of ribs on the side (we are hungry lads). We had cold meats and combo platters to share as well as mixed breads. We nearly rolled out of the restaurant after being there for over three hours.We felt like kings the manager even came out for a chat and recommended some bars we should go to that night. I have honestly never eaten so well or been to a better restaurant. I would say to anyone visiting London and wanting a top quality steak to go to this Restaurant in Leister Square. We have been told were back in London in November and we are all looking forward to our Trip to Angus Steak House  we have even planned what sauce we are having on our Ribs. Bring it on! They lived up to their claim of being the best steaks in London

photos.caption: Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom

GjNrDUm7qFkA68A5iN0DHA.text: Good meat. Decent cooked, at the right point and good flavor. Recommended if you are an Angus fan, otherwise it is like other meats.

iE5jC7Du1jqG3hgLJB4m7g.text: The food here is so worth what you pay. Your steak comes just how you want it (which for me is kicking and screaming and brought to the table on a leash) and the staff are friendly, jovial and helpful. I was awfully full.

Nm6IJ5XZ1K9p3lu9cUL1cw.text: Teuer aber ausgezeichnet. Und die Lage ist ohnehin klasse. Die Steaks lassen keine Wünsche offen.

nq7DY8NtbSlTV0v50hNgVA.text: I ordered a T-bone steak, one of the best I had.  Our waiter was friendly, service was a bit slow but it was busy.

OnXbtaw5Q5gRhvyEz8n4Mw.text: Ordered a medium rare 18-oz T-bone steak. Received an 8-oz sirloin steak without any explanation given when I asked what happened. I don't recommend this place to anyone, absolutely ridiculous and not even worth the one star.

vPoh2zAVtU5DxKhSkH6ISw.text: Uncomfortable is the only word to describe this restaurant. Located in a very touristy area in London, I can understand the staffs frustration and lack of patience. But don't take it out on the nice customers please!! Our waitress was super rude and would become bitter at the simplest requests e.g. asking to split the bill, a refill on a drink, etc. So uncomfortable to be dining there. When we placed our orders after sitting there being ignored for a solid 10 minutes in an almost empty restaurant, o asked for a dirty martini to which she replied "no. We don't do that here." What kind of a bar restaurant in a huge city doesn't or won't make a simple martini?! So bizarre. If you're in the area just keep walking and go to one of the other thousand restaurants nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom. Greek salad. Nasty
Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom. Pimms

-brtJmLsVTDF-hKeGqOucw.text: Don't let the looks fool you! The restaurant looks nice but the steaks were not good. The meat was bland and dry-we had the rib eye and the Angus filet. The rib eye had too much tendon. Ordered a lemonade but it came out as a Sprite with a lemon wedge-when asked about that, they did take it back. There was also a "cover charge" we didn't know about-even though it's just 1 pound each, it would be nice to know ahead of time. For 2, it came to be 55 pounds along with a tip. We regret not checking with Yelp before settling for this place.

AH1VCL9H8zXJv52n9I9_Hg.text: On holiday in England visiting family and stopped for dinner on a Saturday night at this place. Pretty standard. Portions were a bit small and the food was ok. Prices were a bit high, but then again, everything in the city is. May try it again if I am in the area.

miwKq5PyrEz9kAmJILsnsw.text: Very good food and perfect service..! Thanks to Francesco.We didn't know but now we can recommend it!!

UOXxoippd96WAcrB_M1uUg.text: Briefly visiting London from the U.S. Loving London and this steakhouse. Very good service. Good food. Nice and helpful staff and on a Friday evening, too!

15T-rN-f8ZVEMtOXolCfJA.text: The Angus Steak House is in a premium tourist location, Leicester Square. They employ a lot of nice ladies, including the one in front of the outside dining area who's being paid to lure you in. You wouldn't really expect this to be a place for budget dining, and you'd be right: The steaks are of great quality, if not only cooked to order (my 300g sirloin steak, ordered rare, came almost well-done - I sent it back. The second time they got it right). But they sure aren't cheap, since they come without chips or salad or sauce! I ordered the sweet potato chips on the side, and those were fine. However, my starter, garlic mushrooms, was a big disappointment: The mushrooms clearly came from the can, and there was no garlicky taste at all. They were also cold when they finally reached my table. Hint: Don't eat here if you're in a hurry. They had Stella from tap, a fiver for a pint. There is a budget menu option at lunchtime, but when I arrived I was told everything but chicken was already out. I told the waitress I wasn't visiting a steak house to eat chicken anyway, upon which she smiled. That should have been my first warning. Service is friendly, if not particularly efficient. I counted four waiters and waitresses that serviced me during the meal. Not counting the "lady bait" at the entrance. Again, it's a premium tourist spot. I wouldn't call it a rip - off,  but £40 for a starter, the steak, the fries, and two pints is something I'm not going to seek out again any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom. Generous portion of sweet potato fries. Not cheap though.
Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom. Sirloin steak with mushroom sauce (extra). The second time they cooked the steak correctly.
Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom. Stella on tap, 5 per pint.

EpLI0D0GEcprXCWwUxjl8g.text: I came here for the last night of vacation. 11PM after a show for dessert and a Guinness. I picked this place to honor a family member - we visited here together about 15 years ago. Immediately upon ordering, we were told we had to leave. Not asked us to order an entree, just told us to get out. I quickly offered to order real food, but they wanted us to leave. We ended up staying...again only for my family member's honor, but I would not recommend this place. The staff is incredibly rude.In terms of the food, my sirloin steak was half fat and absolutely tasteless.

DCHckoaUazjwlul_lDP9mQ.text: Host was very pretty and nice but service is terrible. Sat at my table for more than 5 mins without any service. Not even hello or anything. Don't come here

3uWaXTPeICFJAjtuprJRqA.text: Food was good, had a sea platter to share for starter. The mains however took a very long time to come after. The service was pretty poor, staff seem flustered and at one point I seen a male manager shouting at one other member of staff at the entrance to the restaurant which I felt was extremely unprofessional. At the start I ordered 1 beer, 1 coke and 2 tap waters, however the waitress returned with 2 cokes. The beer was rectified but the waters where never received. I asked for another coke at one point and it never same also, we got the generally idea we had been forgot about with the drink errors and the lateness of the main courses. Over all the food was good, but the service was extremely off putting.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom. Main courses - Duo Ribs & Chicken Alfredo

at2obSH8tP1bxGloCuJi6g.text: I hope those steaks are good because my salad was horrible, poor service from a guy who didn't even bother to give me the change , when asked he replied that "that was tip for the service charge " which it wasn't even on the bill ...so yeah just like all restaurants in Leicester Square give pretty much same "tourist" service

photos.caption: Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom. Horrible salad , haven't received change , "that was tip for the service charge " which it wasn't even on the bill ...

YUkGNsyvKWAEP5WDmBlBsw.text: Food was fine although they forgot our starters at all and out fillet steaks which were their recommendations on their menu were tasteless and dull. What really made me uncomfortable is the waitress was kind of arrogant and the service was not compatible with the price. I felt like I was not served but begged for something at a moment. All in all, the dinner was not a pleased experience in my case.

iUiPOlxXUffZrgwpN3zCCg.text: Waited almost 60 minutes for steak and chips. After 45 minutes the waiter said the food is coming shortly.... Really???  I don't even want to give the food a score.  Not worth it.  Stay away.

HYwzcUDRnIe9a97RkPG29A.text: The only thing what makes a kind of good impression is the food! My beef fillet 8oz was good! The salad served with it: not fresh at all! Fries were good! Prices are alright!The service sucks completely! That's why just 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus Steak House - London, United Kingdom. Glass of wine!

D80TqI139QTePTjBffyFUw.text: We had a great time EXCEPT the general manager hovered over our table the entire time we were there.  NO JOKE!!!  Our server Faruq (spelling) was charming and quite good.

EyD5EvHoTXUDtf0Qei7m7A.text: Overpriced and underwhelming: do not make the mistake of eating here.Amidst the glistening lights of Piccadilly Circus, one is drawn to the subtle red of the Angus Steakhouse... Do NOT be fooled.The foundation of any reputable steakhouse is the quality of its meat and the manner in which it has been cooked. Here, Angus failed in both respects. My meat was not cooked as per my instruction. Even upon being returned to the kitchen. The meat, which came at a staggering £19, was served alone. Yes. Entirely naked. Devoid of any sides or even a sauce. You were required to pile everything else on top for an additional fee. That would have been acceptable had the meat been up to standard. Next, the waiting staff. Aside from taking 15 minutes to actually take my order, they could do with a class in manners and etiquette. Especially for a seemingly "higher" end establishment. I had to ask for my waitress to be changed. The only bright spark was the hostess/lady at the door. She was wonderfully polite. If you find yourself gazing longingly at the door (seeking to unravel Angus's subtle enigma) walk away very quickly. My advice: head towards the Flatiron Steak establishment 10 minutes away; you will never spend a better £15 on steak!

cH56gs7oluaZKkHr66pcpA.text: Ordered the chicken Alfredo and the chicken skewers the Alfredo was so so and the skewer was horrible the service was pretty slow for the small group we had they did take the skewers of the bill which was nice of them but was disappointing to say the least

AON2UI1epEaxUHOvK0V4Eg.text: Avoid at any cost. The only good things about this place are the dessert and the building.It was way overpriced.The meat was average for the price, and the coleslaw tasted more like glue than actual coleslaw (still charges you 3.50£ for it somehow)The biggest problem is the staff. The waiters are really bad at their job. Not only are they bad at serving you, but they are also really bad at talking behind customers back and making fun of them. Most of the time, they would just stand next to the bar and talk to each other and giggle like little teenage girls and whining about how that guy eats or how this other guy looks like a fat frog when he eats. Best part is that they don't whisper when they say stuff like that and you can hear everything. And they expect you to tip them hahaha.One advice  : if you want meat, you're better off with a double whopper from burger king.AVOID THIS PLACE

w_r0lwJk3nm7bAzWhWwdlQ.text: The food is OK but the service is very slow and the waiters' attitudes are very bad.
